timeline.message: QFJ-905 changed wildcard imports to single class imports

timeline.bodyText: I am asking myself if we could use String.join() or respectively StringJoiner here.  We can also pass a delimiter there and hence would not need the loop and the code would be cleaner. What do you think?
timeline.author: chrjohn

replies.bodyText: OK, just realized that we would need to convert the char to CharSequence or wrap it in String.valueOf( char ) then.
replies.author: chrjohn

replies.bodyText: I was thinking about the same, but StringBuilder was better.
replies.author: the-thing

replies.bodyText: Because of the needed char to String conversion? Or because of other reasons?
replies.author: chrjohn

timeline.bodyText: We could use a Matcher here and re-use the Pattern. OTOH this would not be thread-safe anymore and we would need synchronization or ThreadLocal. Probably not worth to be changed.
timeline.author: chrjohn

replies.bodyText: Yes. Matchers are thread safe, but patterns are not so at the end we still have to create local pattern which is essentially what String class does. Garbage creation in QuickFIX is probably one of the biggest complaint people make, but this probably requires refactoring in other places more.
replies.author: the-thing

timeline.bodyText:
I think this regex needs to be changed to comply to the definition as per the FIX spec of character since it would not match punctuation: https://fiximate.fixtrading.org/en/FIX.5.0SP2_EP255/fix_datatypes.html

Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).

TBH there seems to be no field which has a char value which would not match that regex. However, I think we should adhere to the spec here.
timeline.author: chrjohn

replies.bodyText:
"Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M)."
It would make sens that a char is any ascii char at the end, except the | delimiter of course...
replies.author: charlesbr1

replies.bodyText:
Have a look at the latest commit guys. I added more specific test cases and I think that's what you both guys proposing.
I kept the separator to single space character because quickfix.DataDictionary#isFieldValue supports it.
replies.author: the-thing

timeline.message: QFJ-905 added non whitespace character matching
QFJ-905 added non whitespace character matching
